data.title: City of Pigeon Forge, Tennessee
data.text:
Schedules:

Daily 8:00am - Midnight, March through the first week of January

Daily 10:00am - 10:00pm, January through the first week of March

Closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and Christmas Day

Main Street transit run every 20 to 25 minutes. Wears Valley transits run every 40 to 45 minutes. Dollywood transits run every 15 to 20 minutes. Dolly’s Splash Country transits run every 15 to 20 minutes. Gatlinburg Welcome Center transits run every 25 to 30 minutes. These times may vary due to traffic flow during peak tourism days, car shows and holiday weekends.

Fares

Individual fares paid each time you board a transit. Pigeon Forge Mass Transit drivers will accept exact fare only. Sorry, the transit drivers cannot make change. For a great deal, consider our All Day Transit Pass available for purchase at the Pigeon Forge Mass Transit office or mobile app. Our safe and courteous drivers will pick you up or drop you off at more than 100 stops throughout the city of Pigeon Forge and and a portion Sevierville. Just wait at a city logo transit sign or a transit shelter and we will be there shortly. See the city of Pigeon Forge and a portion of Sevierville in a safe and unique way.

Click Here for Fare Cost

* All Day Passes may only be purchased at the Pigeon Forge Mass Transit office, on the mobile app, or ticket vending machines.

Pigeon Forge Mass Transit Passes will not work on city of Gatlinburg's Trolleys.

Route Map

Routes:

North Parkway:

The North Parkway transit leaves Patriot Park and travels north through Pigeon Forge and continues on into a portion of Sevierville. After traveling north to the Governor’s Crossing & Wal-Mart areas, it turns south again and returns to Patriot Park. **Arrival times every 20 minutes.

South Parkway:

The South Parkway transit leaves Patriot Park and travels east to Teaster, then north to Jake Thomas with a stop at LeConte Convention Center. Then turns left onto Parkway South to light #6, Pine Mountain Rd. The Trolley goes as far as the Mainstay Suites before returning to the parkway. This Transit then travels to the south city limits serving campgrounds in the area and the Dolly Parton's Stampede before returning to Patriot Park. ** Arrival times every 25 minutes.

Gatlinburg Welcome Center:

This transit leaves from Patriot Park and travels non-stop to the Gatlinburg Welcome Center on the spur just outside of Gatlinburg and then returns to Patriot Park. The hours of operation for this transit are subject to the schedule of the city of Gatlinburg’s transits. **Arrival times every 30 minutes.

Dollywood:

Dollywood Transit leaves Patriot Park and travels to and from Dollywood continuously. The Transit runs thirty minutes before Dollywood opens and in the evening until everyone is returned to Patriot Park. **Arrival times every 15 minutes.

Dolly’s Splash Country: !

This route is currently not running.

Wears Valley:

The Wears Valley transit leaves Patriot Park and travels north on Teaster Lane through the Pigeon River Crossings Mall/Riverview Mall area to traffic light #2 on the parkway. From light #2 the transit proceeds to Community Center Drive, Sand Pike Blvd. and then onto Wears Valley Road where it services area campgrounds and other businesses as it continues westbound to the Pigeon Forge city limits before returning to Patriot Park by the same route. **Arrival times every 1 hour.

** Denotes that these arrival times may be delayed considerably during high traffic times such as during car shows, parades, holidays, and other special events. All arrival times are approximate times.
